item.title: 文件显示，布里奇沃特在大选推动的反弹前加大了对银行的押注
item.description: 布里奇沃特联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）的证券文件显示，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得美国总统大选后出现反弹之前，该公司在第三季度的投资组合中增加了大银行的股票。【原文：Bridgewater Associates added shares of big banks to its portfolio in the third quarter, securities filings showed, ahead of a rally that followed Donald Trump’s victory in the U.S. presidential election.】

item.title: 空客首席执行官称 SpaceX 无法通过欧洲反垄断测试
item.description: 航空航天集团空中客车公司（Airbus）负责人周四表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在火箭到卫星领域取得巨大成功的 SpaceX 公司如果必须在欧洲运营，将引发反垄断问题。【原文：Elon Musk's hugely successful rockets-to-satellites SpaceX venture would raise anti-trust concerns if it had to operate in Europe, the head of aerospace group Airbus said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普过渡团队考虑由现任和前任美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）官员担任该机构主席
item.description: 据四位知情人士透露，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普过渡团队的官员正在考虑由现任和前任商品期货交易委员会官员担任该机构主席。【原文：Officials on President-elect Donald Trump's transition team are considering current and former Commodity Futures Trading Commission officials for chair of the agency, according to four people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 波音聘请诺斯罗普高管接管五角大楼项目
item.description: 波音公司周四表示，已聘请前诺斯罗普-格鲁曼公司（Northrop Grumman）高管科林-米勒（Colin Miller）担任公司防务业务部门幻影工程研究机构的负责人。【原文：Boeing said on Thursday it hired former Northrop Grumman executive Colin Miller to head its Phantom Works research arm within the company's defense business unit.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：美国监管机构计划调查微软云计算业务
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四援引知情人士的话报道称，美国联邦贸易委员会正准备对微软云计算业务的反竞争行为展开调查。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is preparing to launch an investigation into anti-competitive practices at Microsoft's cloud computing business, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 共和党横扫后，DBRS 对美国财政状况 "更加警惕
item.description: 负责全球主权评级的董事总经理尼古拉-詹姆斯（Nichola James）周四告诉路透社，共和党在美国大选中的横扫使评级机构晨星DBRS对美国的财政状况 "更加警惕"。【原文：A Republican sweep in the U.S. elections puts rating agency Morningstar DBRS “more on alert” regarding the country’s fiscal accounts, managing director for global sovereign ratings Nichola James told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: TikTok 向全球广告商推出人工智能视频平台
item.description: ByteDance 旗下的 TikTok 周四宣布向全球所有广告商提供其人工智能视频创作平台 Symphony Creative Studios，该短视频应用希望借此提升其广告业务。【原文：ByteDance-owned TikTok on Thursday announced the global availability of its generative AI video creation platform, Symphony Creative Studios, to all advertisers, as the short-video app looks to boost its ad business.】

item.title: 独家报道特朗普过渡团队旨在扼杀拜登电动汽车税收抵免政策
item.description: 两位直接了解此事的消息人士告诉路透社，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的过渡团队正计划取消针对购买电动汽车的 7500 美元消费者税收抵免，将其作为更广泛的税制改革立法的一部分。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump's transition team is planning to kill the $7,500 consumer tax credit for electric-vehicle purchases as part of broader tax-reform legislation, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 谷歌为 iPhone 带来人工智能语音助手 Gemini Live
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周四在苹果应用商店（App Store）发布了一款人工智能聊天机器人智能手机应用，将最新一代语音助手引入了流行的移动操作系统。【原文：Alphabet's Google on Thursday released a smartphone app for its artificial intelligence chatbot on Apple's App Store that introduced the latest generation of its voice assistant to the popular mobile operating system.】

item.title: 被监管机构阻止或面临严格审查的美国交易
item.description: 在美国联邦贸易委员会（FTC）提起诉讼后，Tapestry 放弃了以 85 亿美元收购 Michael Kors 所有者卡普里公司的计划，这是拜登政府最新的一次监管挤压。【原文：Tapestry abandoned its $8.5 billion bid for Michael Kors owner Capri after a judge blocked it following a lawsuit by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC), in the latest regulatory squeeze under the Biden administration.】

item.title: 法官裁定卡夫亨氏必须面对 Mac & Cheese 诉讼
item.description: 一名联邦法官称，卡夫亨氏必须面对一项全国范围的集体诉讼，该诉讼指控卡夫亨氏声称其最知名的产品之一--卡夫奶酪通心粉不含人工防腐剂，从而欺骗了消费者。【原文：A federal judge said Kraft Heinz must face a proposed nationwide class action alleging that it defrauded consumers by claiming its Kraft macaroni and cheese, one of its best-known products, contains no artificial preservatives.】

item.title: 亚马逊进军远程医疗领域，Hims & Hers股价受挫
item.description: 在亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）推出为远程医疗就诊提供预付费的竞争服务后，Hims & Hers Health 公司的股价周四暴跌 15%。【原文：Shares of Hims & Hers Health slumped 15% on Thursday after Amazon.com launched a rival service that offers upfront pricing for telehealth visits.】

item.title: 巴宝莉希望 "围巾吧"、泡芙夹克和经典款式能推动业绩扭亏为盈
item.description: 巴宝莉希望店内的 "围巾吧"、新系列的泡芙夹克，以及更加专注于经典产品而非新款时尚，能够帮助其品牌扭转颓势。【原文：Burberry is hoping "scarf bars" in its stores, new ranges of puffer jackets, and a sharper focus on its classic products rather than new fashions will help to turn its brand around.】

item.title: 巴金工资、可能的关税、谨慎宣布通胀胜利的理由
item.description: 里士满联储主席汤姆-巴金（Tom Barkin）周四表示，工会高额的工资结算和即将到来的关税上调可能性等不确定因素可能会让美国联邦储备委员会官员更加谨慎地认为他们已经赢得了与高通胀的斗争。【原文：High union wage settlements and the possibility of coming tariff increases are among the uncertainties that could make U.S. Federal Reserve officials more cautious about thinking they have won their battle against high inflation, Richmond Federal Reserve president Tom Barkin said on Thursday.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》称，美国监管机构希望将谷歌置于联邦监管之下
item.description: 据《华盛顿邮报》报道，美国消费者金融保护局（CFPB）已采取措施，将 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司置于正式的联邦监管之下，这可能是对这家大型科技巨头的又一次监管挑战。【原文：The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has taken steps to put Alphabet's Google under formal federal supervision, the Washington Post reported, potentially mounting yet another regulatory challenge for the Big Tech giant.】

item.title: 福特汽车因延迟召回后视摄像头被美国处以 1.65 亿美元民事罚款
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，福特汽车已同意接受 1.65 亿美元的民事罚款，因为政府调查发现该汽车制造商未能及时召回后视摄像头存在缺陷的车辆。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Thursday Ford Motor has agreed to a $165 million civil penalty after a government investigation found the automaker failed to recall vehicles with defective rearview cameras in a timely manner.】

item.title: 墨西哥谢因鲍姆将在未来几天内提出非转基因玉米的宪法保障措施
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆周四表示，墨西哥政府将在未来几天内提出一项计划，根据宪法保护该国的非转基因白玉米。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Thursday that her government would in the coming days present a plan to protect the country's non-genetically modified white corn under the constitution.】

item.title: LME 清算所宣布改革，将会员资本要求提高三倍
item.description: 伦敦金属交易所清算所周四提出改革建议，以增强稳定性，包括将会员的资本要求提高两倍。【原文：The London Metal Exchange's clearing house proposed reforms on Thursday to boost stability including tripling the capital requirements for members.】

item.title: 信实集团与华特迪士尼完成价值 85 亿美元的印度媒体资产合并案
item.description: 信实工业公司和华特迪斯尼公司周四完成了价值 85 亿美元的印度媒体资产合并。【原文：Reliance Industries and Walt Disney on Thursday completed the $8.5 billion merger of their Indian media assets, which have been split into three divisions, with each unit having its own CEO.】

item.title: 文件显示埃克森美孚将在得克萨斯州裁员近 400 人
item.description: 根据一份监管文件，埃克森美孚收购页岩生产商先锋自然资源公司后，将在得克萨斯州裁员近 400 人。【原文：Exxon Mobil will cut nearly 400 jobs in Texas following its purchase of shale producer Pioneer Natural Resources, according to a regulatory filing.】

item.title: Stellantis 承诺不会关闭意大利工厂或裁员
item.description: 斯特兰蒂斯汽车公司的一位高管周四在意大利政府为解决该国汽车工业问题而组织的会谈中表示，该公司不打算关闭在意大利的工厂或进行大规模裁员。【原文：Stellantis does not plan to close plants or make mass redundancies in Italy, an executive at the automaker said on Thursday during talks organised by the Italian government to address concerns about the country's car industry.】

item.title: 巴西 JBS 发现美国肉类需求强劲
item.description: 巴西 JBS 美国公司总裁 Wesley Batista Filho 周四在该公司第三季度财报电话会议上表示，全球最大的肉类加工企业 JBS 认为美国对牛肉、猪肉和鸡肉的需求 "非常强劲"。【原文：Brazil's JBS, the world's largest meatpacker, sees "very strong" demand for beef, pork and chicken in the U.S., said the president of JBS USA, Wesley Batista Filho on Thursday during the firm's third quarter earnings call.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份生产者价格如期上涨
item.description: 受投资组合管理和医院门诊护理等服务成本上升的影响，美国生产者价格在10月份有所回升，这进一步证明降低通胀的进程正在停滞不前。【原文：U.S. producer prices picked up in October, lifted by higher costs for services like portfolio management and hospital outpatient care, further evidence that progress toward lower inflation was stalling.】

item.title: 最新美国经济数据公布后，交易员继续押注 12 月降息
item.description: 与美联储政策利率挂钩的期货走低，因为数据显示上个月批发价格的坚挺程度略高于预期，但这还不足以表明交易商对美国央行下个月将再次削减短期借贷成本失去信心。【原文：Futures tied to the Federal Reserve's policy rate edged down after data showed wholesale prices firmed a little more than expected last month, though not enough to suggest traders have lost confidence that the U.S. central bank will cut short-term borrowing costs again next month.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数下降；失业人数减少
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数有所下降，这表明劳动力市场继续保持良好态势，10月份就业增长的突然放缓只是一种反常现象。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell last week, suggesting the labor market continued to chug along and that the abrupt slowdown in job growth in October was an aberration.】

item.title: 欧盟因 Facebook Marketplace 的滥用行为对 Meta 罚款 7.97 亿欧元
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四在一份声明中称，对 Meta Platforms 公司处以 7.9772 亿欧元（8.4024 亿美元）的罚款，原因是该公司滥用 Facebook Marketplace 的优势，这证实了路透社早些时候的报道。【原文：The European Commission on Thursday fined Meta Platforms €797.72 million ($840.24 million) over abusive practices benefiting Facebook Marketplace, it said in a statement, confirming an earlier report by Reuters.】

item.title: ASML 首席执行官称人工智能的蓬勃发展有利于公司发展
item.description: ASML 首席执行官克里斯托夫-富凯（Christophe Fouquet）周四表示，人工智能计算机芯片的持续蓬勃发展将有助于 ASML 提高先进逻辑和存储芯片的相对制造份额，从而增加公司最佳工具的销售量。【原文：ASML CEO Christophe Fouquet said on Thursday the ongoing boom in AI computer chips would help ASML by increasing the relative share of advanced logic and memory chips being made, leading to more sales of the company's best tools.】

item.title: 账目显示，欧洲央行对通胀过度疲软的风险存在分歧
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）周四公布的 10 月 16-17 日会议记录显示，上个月的降息被视为应对意外低通胀的保险举措，但决策者们似乎对价格增长过低的风险存在分歧。【原文：A European Central Bank rate cut last month was seen as an insurance move against unexpectedly low inflation but policymakers appear divided on the risk of excessively low price growth, the accounts of their Oct 16-17 meeting showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 西班牙合作伙伴称，中国奇瑞将把巴塞罗那生产推迟至 2025 年第四季度
item.description: 中国汽车制造商奇瑞的西班牙合作伙伴埃布罗公司（Ebro）的一位高管周四表示，奇瑞将把在西班牙的汽车生产推迟到 2025 年第四季度，这比之前的计划晚了大约一年。【原文：Chinese carmaker Chery will delay the start of vehicle production in Spain to the fourth quarter of 2025, an executive at its Spanish partner Ebro said on Thursday, about a year behind a previous schedule.】

item.title: 希尔顿将股票回购计划增加 35 亿美元
item.description: 希尔顿全球周四表示，已授权根据该酒店巨头现有的回购计划，再回购价值 35 亿美元的普通股。【原文：Hilton Worldwide said on Thursday it had authorized the repurchase of an additional $3.5 billion worth of common stock under the hotel giant's existing repurchase program.】
